Join us on May 9 to celebrate 100 years of the ACLU!
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

It's the ACLU of Massachusetts' 100th year, and we're marking the anniversary with a grand celebration to honor the ACLU's inspiring history of leading the fight for civil rights and civil liberties in the Commonwealth and across the nation.

On Saturday, May 9, the ACLU of Massachusetts will host a Centennial Dinner at the Boston Convention and Exhibition Center in Seaport.

2020 Centennial Bill of Rights Dinner

Join us for a celebration of ACLU's 100th anniversary.

Saturday, May 9, 5:30 p.m.
Boston Convention Center
415 Summer St.
Boston, MA 02210

RSVP TODAY


Tickets and sponsorships are available now! Speakers to be announced soon.

In 1920, a small group of idealists gathered on Beacon Hill and formed the Massachusetts Civil Liberties Union. Since then, thousands have joined and led the ACLU at the forefront of virtually every major battle for civil liberties and equal justice in this country.

We invite you to join on Saturday, May 9 for a celebratory evening of spirited resistance to recognize the heroes among us and light the torch for the next 100 years.

In solidarity,

ACLU of Massachusetts
